Vocabularies.Definition: n. 砖
n.  well-lit workroom of a painter, a photographer, etc. 画室；照相室；工作室
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She was in her studio again, painting onto a large canvas.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    菊苣
n. （一道）生菜； 色拉
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  a salad of tomato, onion and cucumber

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  主教
n.    衣袖
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  His sleeves were rolled up to his elbows.

Vocabularies.Definition: 灯笼袖
harmonious(ly) 和谐的（地）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  It was just an ordinary voice, but he sang in tune.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.   held or done by two or more persons together 共同的；共有的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She had taken the money out of the joint account she had with her husband.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   肺炎
v.   (of an evil force)move through(a place)in a threatening way; move quietly and cautiously in order to get near 可怕地蔓延或游荡（于）；潜行，偷偷接近
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  When night falls, danger stalks the streets of the city.

Vocabularies.Definition: in various places 各处 e.g.  During the summer vacation he will do a bit of teaching here and there.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  very cold, like ice 极冷的；冰冷的
n.   person, animal, etc. suffering death, injury or loss   牺牲者；受害的人（或动物等） e.g.  Police and hospital records indicate that the majority of victims of domestic violence are women.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad.    not quite; almost not 几乎没有；几乎不 scarce    a.  not plentiful; rare 不充足的；难得的 e.g.  I can scarcely remember when I last ate home-baked bread.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    门厅, 过道
a.  growing thickly; thick and rough 密生的；丛生的 bushy hair
n.    arch of hair above the eye 眉毛
n. ,int.   nonsense 胡说；无意义的话
n.  （四轮）载人马车
vt.  take (a number, quantity) away from 减去；扣除
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Passenger cars can be added or subtracted at either end of the subway train.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.    able to cure illness 能治病的 a curative herb
a.   happy; cheerful; bright and gay 高兴的；愉快的；欢乐的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  From the other room, we could hear the merry sound of laughter and glasses clinking.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. (pl.)  sheets, blanket, etc. for a bed 床上用品
ad.   with the back or end  first 倒着
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The helicopter can travel forward, backward, or sideways.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  without covering, clothing, or decoration 光秃秃的；裸露的；无装饰的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Soil held in place by plant roots is less likely to blow or wash away than bare soil.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. dull; gloomy; causing low spirits 沉闷的；阴沉的；使人忧郁的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  By the time they had waited five hours for their delayed flight, everyone looked dreary.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   常春藤
n.  藤，藤本植物；攀缘植物
in a low voice 低声地
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He bent down and addressed her in a whisper.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   foolish talk, ideas, behavior 废话；荒唐的念头；愚蠢的行为
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I think the report is nonsense and nothing but a waste of paper.

Vocabularies.Definition: allow (sth.) to be free of control 放手，放纵
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The sick whale will be taken care of by the scientists before being turned loose.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    man who works in a mine 矿工
n.   person who paints pictures; artist 画图者；画家
n.   胡须
have an appearance for a particular job, role, or position 看上去很像
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I think he must be a captain -- he certainly looks the part.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  杜松子酒
to an extreme degree 过度
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   His father never smoked or drank to excess.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  a piece of work, esp. art, which is the best of its type or the best a person has done（尤指艺术品）杰作； 代表作
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn is considered Mark Twain's masterpiece.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.   easily damaged or broken; not strong and healthy 易碎的；虚弱的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The thin glass is fragile.

Vocabularies.Definition: as regards other matters 至于其它
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The book contains some interesting passages about the author's childhood. For the rest, it is rather dull.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  violent and angry 凶猛的；愤怒的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  It was estimated that the fierce storm killed at least several thousand people and left more than one million without homes.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.  ridicule; make fun of 嘲弄；取笑
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  They mocked him and called him a coward.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   lack in strength and determination 软弱；意志不坚定
ad.    暗淡地；模糊不清地 dim   a.
n.  （油画）画布
n.   画架
n.  sth. imagined; unfounded opinion or belief 幻想，幻觉；胡思乱想
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The forecasts in his book were not wild fancies.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.   move in a continuous flow, pour out 流，淌；涌
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The river streamed past my house.

Vocabularies.Definition: be told about or have knowledge of 听说，得知
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Three weeks passed, and nothing was heard of the missing boy.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.   continuing; occurring again and again 持续的；一再发生的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The persistent growth of the EU countries has been remarkable.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. mix 混合
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The singer's style mingles jazz and country music.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  turned upside down 翻转的，倒着放的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He clung to the upturned boat, screaming for help.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  烧水用的壶
raise 拉起
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The old woman pulled the curtain up to see what was going on outside.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad.  tiredly 疲倦地；劳累地 weary    a.
int.  look; see 看，瞧
be easily seen above or among others 显著；突出
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The working experience in Microsoft last year still stands out in my mind.

Vocabularies.Definition: (of time) pass gradually; (cause to) become thin or damaged by constant use  （时间）流逝；磨损，磨去
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  They didn't reach an agreement. Instead they wore the afternoon away in arguing.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   faint light after sunset; the time just before night 暮色；黄昏
a.   solitary; without companion 孤独的；孤单的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He was shot by a lone gunman.

Vocabularies.Definition: (clung)  vi.   hold tight; resist separation 抓紧；抱紧 cling to  hold tight to 紧紧抓住（或抱住）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The child is clinging to his mother's legs.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  showing no mercy 无慈悲心的；无怜悯心的
attract the attention of (sb.) by speaking out 呼唤
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The fisherman called to the villagers on the shore.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    煤气；天然气
n.    炉；火炉；暖炉
n.    offence against God, religion or good morals 罪孽；罪过
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  In Christian theology, the first sin was committed by Adam.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  带手柄的小镜子
n.    枕头
坐起来
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The teacher asked his students to sit up straight.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  (of diseases) coming quickly to the critical stage; severe 急性的；严重的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She was taken to the hospital suffering from acute appendicitis.

Vocabularies.Definition: be wet all over 湿透的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Their house was flooded: the carpet was wet through and the furniture was ruined.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  灯笼
n. 调色板
v.  (cause to) move about in a quick, irregular way 飘动，晃动
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The ugly duckling fluttered into the milk-pan, and splashed the milk about the room.
